intro: Conceveiba praealta, commonly known as the tall conceveiba, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Conceveiba praealta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
